DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test effect videotelephone-delivered patient-partner dual-focused cognitive behavioral stress management intervention chronic fatigue syndrome ( CFS ) symptom relate psychosocial neuroimmune process patient diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome . Study test hypothesis videophone-delivered patient-partner cognitive behavioral stress management ( T-PP-CBSM ) intervention improve patient CFS symptom relative videophone-delivered patient-partner Health Information ( PP-T- HI ) condition .
DOC.brief_title: Patient-Partner Stress Management Effects Chronic Fatigue Syndrome Symptoms Neuroimmune Process
DOC.detailed_description: The study test effect 10-week patient-partner focus videophone-delivered cognitive behavioral stress management intervention ( T-PP-CBSM ) intervention ( relaxation , stress awareness , cognitive restructuring , cop skill training , interpersonal skill train ) versus time-attention-matched 10-week patient-partner base videophone-delivered health information ( T-PP-HI ) ( health behavior education nutrition , sleep factor ) men woman chronic fatigue syndrome ( CFS ) partner . The study evaluate effect T-PP-CBSM vs T-PP-HI patient CFS symptom , neuroimmune process -- diurnal cortisol regulation immune regulation ( pro-inflammatory : anti-inflammatory cytokine ratio ( [ IL-1β + IL-6 + TNF-α ] : [ IL-13 + IL-10 ] ) —and psychosocial function 5 month 9 month intervention .
DOC.criteria: men woman diagnose chronic fatigue syndrome partner prior psychiatric treatment serious psychiatric disorder ( e.g. , psychosis , suicidality ) comorbidity medical treatment affect immune system lack fluency English
